caption: The food was good, service not so good. Our waiter was kind but it seemed like he was trouble understanding what we were trying to order. He actually asked us to show him on the menu what we wanted to drink. He was so slow that 3 other tables left early. We literally heard the patrons say “we’re leaving because the service is slow”. It was not busy and we were trying to figure out what was making him slow. We would have bought a couple of more drinks but feared more of the slowness. It was our first time there and we do frequent Harbor East a lot so we’ll give this place another chance as long as we don’t get the same server.

Waiter served us mimosas for brunch- then asked us for identification after they were on the table. Clearly was afraid of getting reprimanded and didn't comp us anything for the trouble. One bad apple in an otherwise above average hotel restaurant. Cool themed drink selection at night too.
Horrible experience and rude service. The food is a disgrace and really small like a kid's meal. Very disappointing especially at the Marriott!

Valentine's day is the same date every year and sadly Apropoe's clearly was not prepared for Valentine's day 2020.  The hostess could definitely use some customer service training and how to appropriately respond to questions instead of saying "what". Our server was running from table to table trying to keep up with everyone's needs and wants but it was nearly impossible.  We waited 45mins for our salad, honey old bay wings, and tomato soup that was served lukewarm. After being served our appetizers we waited another 45-50 mins for our main entree. The crabcakes taste like they had been sitting and were dried out  and the potato/carrot dish was COLD! Very disappointed and a waste of our time.

Excellent. Came for lunch with a colleague on Saturday. Crab Cake sandwich was fresh and delicious, side salad was quite good. Our server Mohamed was wonderful as well, extremely pleasant and informative :)
The food was tasty and had a local flare. The staff was great, though they were a bit understaffed. It’s a hotel, so it was a little pricey.

Please heed my warning! DO NOT COME HERE!!!! This is a APROPOE-POE-NO!!!!!!!This was my first and last time at Aprope’s. If you are planning to come here cancel your plans and go somewhere else. I could have went to Royal Farms Chicken to get better service. All the food was cold and came out an hour after we ordered. Maybe if more staff was hired to cook food and serve this place would have gotten a better review. Terrible service for a restaurant that is in a nice hotel. Very disappointing
Great brunch
Take a jacket, it's cold in side.
Breakfast was wonderful both days.
The crab chowder was delicious! The crabcake sandwich was enormous. Great ambiance!
Love the atmosphere and everyone was friendly
Food and drinks were amazing, except for the chocolate cake. I won't take off a star for that.
Fantastic chef who came out to discuss my dietary requests. Created an incredible meal. Not inexpensive but well worth it. Bar staff was great. You will love this place.
Great quality, good service, you're downtown so it's not cheap eats.  As expected from Marriott, it is five star.  I'm never disappointed in Marriott product or service.
It's OK for a lobby bar
I had dinner at the bar, service was very attentive and quick. Kate the bartender was very nice. The food was excellent.
Limited choices .. if your room rate includes breakfast they will still charge you if you dont tell them that ..
Very limited choice is terms food. Service is a bit strange. One meal was served by many  different persons.  The food itself was good but the portions could have been better.
Good place
Great service good food and drinks. Great ambience. Spacious but still can get loud
Good
Service was slow but I guess they want you to relax and enjoy the scenery. Very laid back atmosphere. Food was good.

I thought the food was of really good quality for bar food.  The crab cake was a decent size and def had a bunch of back fin in it.  The Chincoteague oysters were amazing, really big and meaty!  I had the house Cab.  The bar was pretty big, and it had a great ambiance to it.  Check this place out!
Awesome dining experience.  Great menu and the Seafood Quatro was awesome, especially the Seared Tuna Steaks
Limited menu. Expensive. Great staff. Quiet if you choose an of peace time.
Excellent food. Great service.
Great considing it is in a hotel lobby
Excellent atmosphere, great service.
Most expensive beer in Baltimore. Otherwise great.

This is certainly one of the most fantastic foods I've had in a long time. Crab cakes are amazing, the eggplant bean paste on the cauliflower crust is to die for I also had an eggplant white bean ragout with the rice bowl that I simply loved the shaft is outstanding and made my stay in Maryland even more special
Excellent food but service depends on the staff present. Try the grilled cheese sandwich with fig jam  and tomato soup.
Rice Bowl was good. Wine/Beer list was above average. Some local micros. Understand this is inside the Marriott hotel.
Went for a quick lunch before a meeting. Great service. Food was solid but a little expensive. It was a off lunch hour and we we're the only customers.

High end hotel-type restaurant with small menu of only specialty dishes. It's self described as Poe themed but, if you're a Poe fan don't expect much. I mean, at least have a pendulum somewhere or a shadow of a black on the wall. The glass light fixtures were unique but very dirty and dusty. The food was not impressive.  The next day I sat at the bar for a couple of drinks. I ordered a scotch, neat. The glass was dirty and there was a fly in my drink. It was like a butt of a joke. I asked for a replacement and got another dirty glass with something black floating in it.  I just paid and walked out. I'll never return.

Very nice restaurant. We found this restaurant on Google maps searching for restaurants in Baltimore. It turns out the restaurant is inside of a Marriott hotel. First off the parking situation, there is limited parking on the street but plenty of parking garages. I decided to park in the Marriott parking garage, every spot said either reserved valet or reserved so I thought I couldn't park there  I was in the garage for less than 5 minutes and decided to find somewhere else to park I put my ticket in to exit and it said $15. I was shocked as I was in there for 5 minutes it less. I pushed the call button and talked to the parking garage customer service and they said, "pay no attention to the signs you can park wherever you like but just remember to take your ticket with you to validate it before you get back to your vehicle. After I left the garage I talked to a Marriott employee and they verified what the parking person said. That was very confusing. Now about the restaurant.  What's unique about this restaurant is that it's a restaurant inside of a restaurant. I had difficulty finding it. You go through the hotel lobby and then you make a left onto a restaurant called illy, and then this restaurant is within it. Never experienced anything like that before.  The food was decent. I want to fond of the appetizer I had. It was the crabcake and it tasted like it came out of the Frozen section of a supermarket. Very mushy. My date ordered the Brazed Chesapeake Bay Mussels, I tasted some of it and I highly recommend that appetizer.  The entrees were great. I had the rib and my date had the salmon. They were excellent.
Very good seafood dishes, including crab chowder, roasted salmon and crab cakes Benedict.  Nice space with high ceilings, friendly service and waterfront views.

Took 40 minutes to get our appetizers. The waiter could not understand us very well because I think he was in training. He never came back to check on us after any of the meals. Waited 20minutes to get our water refilled. Overall

Located in the Marriott in Harbor East, Apropoe's specializes in American comfort food along with a handful of local Maryland favorites like crab cakes.  The menu was crafted by executive chef Carlos Gomez, a world-renowned chef who’s cooked for guests all over the globe.  My favorite dish there was their Cauliflower Ravioli.  It came with roasted eggplant, caramelized onion, and tomato coulis, and it was TO DIE FOR good.  Who the hell knew cauliflower could be so tasty?  The texture was perfection – just the right amount of chewy – and the filling was yumtastic.  Definitely make sure to get an order of their Butter Chicken as well!

I went here on a Friday night.  There were maybe 10 guests dining during our visit.  Our cocktails were great, and the atmosphere was nice.  The menu was pretty lacking.  We weren't impressed with the few options on the menu so we decided to just get a soup and an entree to share.  We tried the cream of crab soup, (and I know my cream of crab soup) and the flavor was good, not great, but I did not find a single morsel of crab meat in the luke warm soup.  The entree we ordered was a sweet potato ravioli over peppers and other roasted veggies.  The peppers were good, the ravioli was boring.   Overall, I would maybe try this place again IF I walked in and checked to make sure their menu had better options this time.   Otherwise, I would walk to any of the really good places nearby.

I’ve visited this restaurant several times and each time had such an amazing meal and experience. I’d totally recommend the butter chicken (as seen on beat bobby flay) and try one of their themed baltimore cocktails. The recently launch a new fall menu that is so delish my recommendation -> the sous vied chicken!

Have eaten here on a few occasions while staying at the Marriott.  The food is always excellent.  I am on Keto during this visit so was happy to find cauliflower pizza crust on the menu.  Even if you are not on Keto this crust is worth a try, it is similar to a thin crust pizza.  The cauliflower taste is minimal, I really only only noticed when I ate the crust by itself.  The wings here are also good, with a great flavor and seasoning.  For those folks on Keto this one is not for you as they are breaded.  Lastly, for those into moonshine ask to have the house drink, not sure if it is on the menu all time but it is worth asking about.  The drink is made in house including the booze and honey.  The menu does change seasonally and depending on items availability so if you are looking for a particular item be sure to check ahead if they have it.  The service would be the only area for improvement as they can be a bit slow depending on what is happening in the hotel, but if you were to let them know you are in a hurry I am sure they will accommodate.  The photo in this review is of the three different pizzas, I shared with some other folks.  The crab was by far my favorite but all were great.

Nice atmosphere, decent enough food, horrible service. The place was nearly empty in the middle of the day when we were seated yet it still took over 10 minutes for anyone to come over to us. We were greeted with a gruff "ready to order". That's it. No "hi" or intro or anything. After some arguing amongst the servers, we were provided a second one (without ever asking) and they were only slightly better. Even if the food were amazing (which it isn't) or the prices were super reasonable (which they aren't) I still would never go back. There is no reason for any place to have service this bad.

Awesome bartenders and delicious spicy margarita. The drinks are a couple more bucks than I wish, but that's expected since it's in the hotel. There's always space on the couches and lots of tvs to watch if you want. A DJ was setting up around 5 on Thursday night so I think they have entertainment on the weekends. They also just started doing happy hour 4-7pm which is cool.
The best breakfast buffet for the price in the area.
Slow service and too much ice in drinks.

Horrible! Our waiter didn’t seem to know what he was doing. We asked him to split the bill 3 way He comes back to say our card didn’t work! (I think not) then continues to say let me try it again. It mysteriously goes through. Not only did he split it 3 ways but then charged our card the whole total again! 280.00 for breakfast.
Wonderful breakfast
Always great
Great ambience

Breakfast buffet was the best and the waiter was extremely helpful. The cheese pizza could have been better. I asked for cheese pizza...had to take off the half cherry tomatoes that I didn't ask for and it was loaded with too much basil when I was told it would be light basil. Mixed drinks could use some work...not enough alcohol when compared to other places and the mojito was a fail.
Great food and atmosphere -- especially good breakfast buffet.  Exceptional service.
Great food and great service, our waitress Ester was fenomenal!!!  Highly recommended
Nice atmosphere and decor. Good prices for happy hour, food and staff were ok - burger comes in a bowl so grease settles at the bottom - maybe request a plate.
Best of the best
Decent hotel bar.

I was a guest at the Marriott.  The first night, the drinks were "meh" and did not have ingredients to make one of their signature Bourbon cocktails that I wanted to try.   Was disappointed by that.  The second night, a different gentleman was working and made a proper old fashioned.
Flippant service middle of the road food, had to wait 30 minutes for a check.
Classy casual with good food service, wonderful decor and relaxing atmosphere.
I really enjoy the food. Atmosphere is a bit lame (it is a hotel restaurant) but service and food make up for it.  The duck Condit quesadilla is one of my favorite dishes there.
My platform

I have been to Apropoe's twice, once as a guest and once as a customer and both times have been beyond excellent. I could not possibly list all the great items I had so I will just hit the highlights - The Mussels in Beer and hushpuppies with jalepenos were both great starters, each presented beautifully. The shrimp and grits may be their best dish but I also loved their short rib. Dessert, from the cheesecake to chocolate cake were to die for. The service both times was just superb, very friendly and helpful. Apropoe's is a good place for a drink with friends or a four course dinner. The only drawback is that it is in Harbor East and all that entails (traffic and parking), but you can get $8 valet parking for three hours with dinner at Apropoe's. This is fairly new to the restaurant scene in Baltimore and a great addition.  Pro Tip: Try some of their Poe themed cocktails,they are DIVINE.
